				<div class="row s-lg-row">
    <div id="s-lg-col-126" class="col-md-12">
        <div class="s-lg-col-boxes s-lg-box-special">
							<div id="s-lg-box-wrapper-20273916" class="s-lg-box-wrapper-20273916">
					<div id="s-lg-box-17227798-container" class="s-lib-box-container">
						<div id="s-lg-box-17227798" class="s-lib-box s-lib-box-std">
							<h2 class="s-lib-box-title">Introduction
                                </h2>
							<div id="s-lg-box-collapse-17227798" >
								<div class="s-lib-box-content">
									
			<div id="s-lg-content-37963889" class="  clearfix">
				<p>If resources are freely accessible and are able to be used by anyone they are called &quot;open.&quot;&nbsp; These range from resources that are publicly owned or &quot;in the public domain&quot; to resources that are licensed through some creative commons licenses.&nbsp; (Note that some creative commons licenses do not allow for derivative work or commercial use - and so those resources are not open.)&nbsp; A great consequence of a resource being open is that you can use, modify, and make derivative work without contacting the author.&nbsp; Your ability to use and remix is only limited by your imagination and, in some cases, your ability to give clear attribution.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

		   </div>
								</div>
								
							</div>
						</div>
					</div>
							</div>
        </div>
    </div>
				
</div>
